title: Differentiation of human subcutaneous adipocytes and measurement of lipolytic function induced by GIP or LY3437943
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Human subcutaneous adipocyte differentiation
Timing: 14 days
        (Day −2) Perform quick thaw (in <2 min) of expanded and cryopreserved
        human subcutaneous preadipocytes (10 million cells/mL in freezing media)
        in a 37°C water bath.
        
            Resuspend cells in GM-2MV centrifuge at 200XG for 10 min at 23–26°C.
          
            Seed them (55K cells/100 μL/well) into the tissue culture-treated
            96-well plates.
          
(Day −1) Remove the EGM-2MV and replace it with 100 μL PM-1.
        (Day 0) Remove PM-1 and replace it with 100 μL DM-2 to initiate
        differentiation.
      
(Day 3) Replenish DM-2 with 100 μL of fresh DM2.
(Day 6) Remove DM-2 and replace it with 100 μL AM-1.
(Day 9) Replenish AM-1 with 100 μL fresh AM-1.
        (Day 12) Subcutaneous adipocytes differentiate sufficiently for use
        (measure lipolytic function on days 12–15 if subcutaneous adipocytes are
        maintained in AM-1).
      
      All these changes across each step of the adipocyte differentiation are
      shown in Figures 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1], 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2] and
      3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3].

Lipolysis assay
Timing: 6 h
        Remove AM-1 media and incubate differentiated subcutaneous adipocytes
        for 2 h in 100 μL DMEM (without supplementation).
      
        In a separate plate, perform dose-response by serial dilution of test
        articles in DMEM: for these experiments, perform 11-point half-log
        dilutions of either GIP or LY3437943 (10−7–10−14),
        as shown in Table 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl1].
        table:files/protocols_protocol_2689_1.csv
          Abbreviation: GIP, glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide.
        
        After 2 h of incubation in DMEM, remove media from the cells and replace
        it with 50 μL of GIP or LY3437943 dose-responses.

After 3 h of incubation in 37°C cell incubator with test articles,
        transfer 20 μL of conditioned media into a 96-well assay plate to
        measure glycerol content as a surrogate of lipolysis.
      
        Glycerol content is measured as follows:
        
Per vendor instructions.
            After 15 min of incubation at 23–26°C, measure optical density
            (540 nm) using BioTek Synergy Neo2 plate reader (Agilent). Data is
            shown in Table 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl2].
            table:files/protocols_protocol_2689_2.csv
              Abbreviation: GIP, glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide.
            
            Interpolate glycerol concentration in conditioned media from the
            glycerol standard curve, as shown in
            Table 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl3] (linear regression).
            table:files/protocols_protocol_2689_3.csv
              Abbreviation: GIP, glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide.
            
        Plot dose-response curves for peptides tested as glycerol in conditioned
        media (y-axis) versus log concentration of peptide (x-axis). Determine
        EC50 using 4-parameter variable slope nonlinear regression.
      
        Assess linear and non-linear regression models using GraphPad Prism
        7.0v.
      
Critical: Perform lipolysis using
      phenol red free DMEM.
